latex:
The \textit{tower function of twos} is defined recursively as follows: $ T(1) = 2$ and $ T(n + 1) = 2^{T(n)}$ for $ n\ge1$. Let $ A = (T(2009))^{T(2009)}$ and $ B = (T(2009))^A$. What is the largest integer $ k$ such that\\
\[ \underbrace{\log_2\log_2\log_2\ldots\log_2B}_{k\text{ times}}
\]is defined?\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 2009\qquad \textbf{(B)}\ 2010\qquad \textbf{(C)}\ 2011\qquad \textbf{(D)}\ 2012\qquad \textbf{(E)}\ 2013$
